key_points: Gabby Petito lived and worked in North Carolina from September 2017 to January 2019.
Petito worked as a hostess and kitchen aide at Smoke on the Water, a restaurant at Carolina Beach.
Friends and co-workers describe Petito as a bright soul who loved and lifted those around her.
Smoke on the Water Restaurant set up a memorial table and plans to plant a tree in memory of Petito.
Petito was killed during a cross-country trip with her fiancé, Brian Laundrie; her body was found in a Wyoming national park.
The coroner confirmed Petito's death as a homicide, with final autopsy results pending.
Brian Laundrie, Petito's fiancé, is a person of interest in the case and went into hiding.
Law enforcement received a tip of a possible Laundrie sighting in Florida, but it led nowhere.
The case of Gabby Petito has drawn attention to other missing persons, highlighting issues of missing people of color.
Legal analysts ponder why an arrest warrant has not been issued for Brian Laundrie.
spokespersons: Lara Witschen (General Manager, Smoke on the Water)
